Posts.Title: Age 27, have had two years of 6mo check ups already. fiddlesticks522 fiddlesticks522

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2018 12:45PM fiddlesticks522 wrote: thank you for asking! I actually just got my MRI results 6 days ago. The MRI wasn’t as bad as I thought it was going to be, I just hate sitting still that long!! Haha Basically they reconfirmed all the previous biopsies in the right breast from the clips they left in there. Then they found a benign looking intramammary lymph node and told me not to worry about it. I’m not completely sure what that means. And then nothing else new was seen luckily. Then my left breast which has basically given me no problems yet, other than a cyst that was drained, they found a small oval mass. Gave it Bi-Rads score 3 (which is a relief because I usually end up as a 4) and told me to get another ultrasound in 6 months.... so I am very relieved there was nothing scary. But I’m also kind of bummed that this 6month cycle road of new findings is still going round and round. I am starting to think it’s going to be the price I have to pay to stay on top of my health and give me the best shot of finding something very early if I do get it Although I did get my results I haven’t had my follow up appointment with the breast surgeon yet, that will be on Monday. So we will see what she says for the larger growths!
